intro: Gustavia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf gustavia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in mangrove swamps or along the shoreline. Gustavia longifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in humid, saline environments.
